result.execSummary:
The defendant Beatrice M Lynch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Mental Health evaluation treatment deemed appropriate.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Attend a Retail Theft Course.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED. To be used at Agent's discretion. Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Beatrice M Lynch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Beatrice M Lynch in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

9 MONTHS HUBER, w/Standard Release Conditions  
 
TERM OF PROBATION:  12 months

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done. 
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
*Attend a Retail Theft course
 
COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
DRGOD Surcharge:  $10.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 30 days, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Beatrice M Lynch in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to the charge. Defense requests a sentencing date. Court grants request.  Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Beatrice M Lynch did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint. Bond to be signed by 07/13/2015.

Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Beatrice M Lynch did not appear.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
